result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. Uttech was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas J. Uttech is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas J. Uttech was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $  TBD   plus surcharges.
*   State shall have 60 days to determine.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes:
Huber and work crew allowed.
***Can be released on Huber to take barber school test and for barber license.***
Credit for 2 days.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

To amend JOC
***Can be released on Huber to take barber school test and for barber license.***
Bond money being held by Circuit Court and to be applied to restitution once determined.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions concurrent to 14CF1054; 9 months conditional jail w/Huber privileges commencing 4/16/16 at 6pm; credit for 2 days served; pay $250 DNA surcharge; restitution to be determined by DOC; bond applied to restitution and costs, bond also applied to costs in 14CF1054; any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  Matter heard with 14CF1054.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  2/15/2016 JS & 2/16/2016 JT removed from the court's calendar.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Attorney K Watson appeared, for Atty A Komp, on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court contacted deft by phone.  JSH continued to 2/3/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Attorney A Komp appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft appeared but was excused to go to school.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 1/28/16 at 1:15pm and JS 2/15/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
Atty Angela Komp

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Angela Komp (for Atty Andrea Rufo).  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Rufo will be taking over the case for Atty Komp.  FPT 11/5/16 at 8:15.  Bond continued.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rufo is out sick.  STC is adjourned to 10/13/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
Status conference at 10-13-2015 08:15 am

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Rufo.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, STC continued to 9/24/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Rufo.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, STC continued to 9/2/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Rufo.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rufo states she believes the case will be resolved.  STC continued to 7/21/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Perz, for Atty A Rufo.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court cancels warrant and reinstates bond.  ADA McNeill notes that the deft missed his jury trial date.  STC set for 6/10/15 at 8:15am.
With Atty Rufo a VA is set for 5/7/15 at 8:30am.
Warrant was not processed; deft is scheduling a voluntary appearance. NO DOCUMENT IN FILE AT TIME OF SCANNING PER INTEGRITY CHECK ( WARRANT NEVER PROCESSED  /PT)
NO DOCUMENT IN FILE AT TIME OF SCANNING PER INTEGRITY CHECK ( WARRANT NEVER PROCESSED PER WARRANT CANCELLATION / PT)

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty A Rufo appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case set for jury selection.  Court forfeits bond and issues warrant $1,000 cash bond.

With Atty Rufo the JSH of 4/9/15 at 1:15pm is cancelled as the deft has school in IL that he can't miss and she is still working on investigation after which she will be attempting to resolve the case w/ADA Phan sometime next week, the case remains set for trial on 4/27/15 at 9am and if resolved will become a plea hearing.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty A Rufo appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court forfeits bond, issues warrant $1,000 cash bond, stayed until 10/21/14 at noon.

No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Assistant District Attorney Zachary Wittchow, special prosecutor, appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Rufo.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rufo acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 9/19/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 9/30/14 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Atty Zach Wittchow appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Andrea Rufo. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 7-31-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.
